title: 107_s1210
content: SECTION 1. SHORT TITLE. The Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Reauthorization Act of 2002 extends block grants, federal guarantees, training, and technical assistance for Native American housing programs until 2007. The Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Reauthorization Act of 2002 extends housing programs until 2007 by amending sections related to fiscal years 1997 through 2007. SEC. 3 of the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 defines 'housing related community development' as tribally-owned facilities that aid in reservation housing construction. It excludes activities under the Indian Gaming Regulatory Act. SEC. 4 of the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 is amended to include comprehensive housing and community development planning activities. SEC. 5 addresses program income and labor standards. SEC. 5 of the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 is amended to address program income utilization for housing-related activities. Section 106(b)(2)(A) of the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 is amended to include regulations required under the Act, even after future amendments. Section 601 is amended to allow federal guarantees for financing tribal housing activities, and feasibility studies are proposed to enhance housing assistance in Native communities. The Determination Act of 1996 is amended to include a community development demonstration project for Indian tribes to use funds for projects. The Secretary is required to conduct a feasibility study and submit it to Congress within a year. The Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Reauthorization Act of 2002 requires a study on establishing a demonstration project for Indian tribes to receive assistance in Federal housing funding, maximizing tribal authority in decision-making. The Secretary must submit the study to Congress within one year of the Act's enactment. The Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Reauthorization Act of 2002 mandates a study for a demonstration project to assist Indian tribes in Federal housing funding, emphasizing tribal decision-making authority. The study must be submitted to Congress within one year of the Act's enactment. The study involves the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs, the Committee on Indian Affairs, the Committee on Financial Services, and the Committee on Resources. SEC. 9. BLACK MOLD INFESTATION STUDY. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development must complete a study on black mold infestation in Native American housing within 180 days of the Act's enactment. A report with recommendations to address the infestation must be submitted to Congress.
